Package server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
ocsf.server.AbstractServer
server.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Server extends ocsf.server.AbstractServer
Represents the BPARK server. Handles incoming client connections and dispatches requests using the OCSF framework. Also starts background threads such as email checking and monthly reporting.

    • Server

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • serverStarted

      protected void serverStarted()
      Called automatically when the server starts. Establishes DB connection and starts the monthly report scheduler.
      Overrides:
      serverStarted in class ocsf.server.AbstractServer

    • handleMessageFromClient

      protected void handleMessageFromClient(Object msg, ocsf.server.ConnectionToClient client)
      Processes incoming messages from connected clients. Each message is expected to be an Object[] with an action string as the first element. Supported actions include login, order management, vehicle pickup, and parking availability.
      Specified by:
      handleMessageFromClient in class ocsf.server.AbstractServer
      Parameters:
      msg - the message received from the client
      client - the sending client

    • handleLogin

      private void handleLogin(Object[] data, ocsf.server.ConnectionToClient client)
      Handles a login request sent from the client side. Expects the data array to contain: {LOGIN, username, password}. If the credentials are valid and the user is not already logged in, the server responds with a successful login. Otherwise, it sends an error message.
      Parameters:
      data - the message array sent from the client (operation + login details)
      client - the connection to the client that sent the login request

    • clientConnected

      protected void clientConnected(ocsf.server.ConnectionToClient client)
      Logs new client connections.
      Overrides:
      clientConnected in class ocsf.server.AbstractServer
      Parameters:
      client - the connecting client

    • clientDisconnected

      protected void clientDisconnected(ocsf.server.ConnectionToClient client)
      Logs when a client disconnects.
      Overrides:
      clientDisconnected in class ocsf.server.AbstractServer
      Parameters:
      client - the disconnecting client

    • logClientDisconnect

      private void logClientDisconnect(ocsf.server.ConnectionToClient client)
      Handles cleanup when a client disconnects from the server. Prints the client's IP and hostname, and if the user was logged in, it updates the database to mark them as logged out.
      Parameters:
      client - the connection of the client that disconnected

    • getConnectedClientInfoList

      public ArrayList<String> getConnectedClientInfoList()
      Returns a list of all connected client hostnames and IPs.
      Returns:
      list of client connection strings

    • generateRandomPassword

      private String generateRandomPassword()
      Generates a random 8-character alphanumeric password.
      Returns:
      random password

    • shutdownGracefully

      public void shutdownGracefully()
      Stops the BPARK server in a clean way. What happens here: - Send "server_shutdown" to every connected client so they can quit nicely. - Close the listening socket (this drops all client sockets too). - Clear is_logged_in for every user in the DB, just to be extra safe. Called from the GUI when the user presses Exit.
